DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine WC3011 safe effective treat symptom painful intercourse secondary vulvovaginal atrophy measure subject self-assessment compare vehicle .
DOC.brief_title: Study Evaluate Safety & Efficacy WC3011 Postmenopausal Women With Dyspareunia
DOC.criteria: Sexually active selfidentified dyspareunia ( pain sexual activity ) , least moderate severe & bothersome symptom VVA ( vulvovaginal atrophy ) Postmenopausal & meet 1 follow : 12 month spontaneous amenorrhea , 6 month spontaneous amenorrhea FSH ( follicle stimulate hormone ) > 40 mIU/mL,6 week postsurgical bilateral oophorectomy confirmation FSH > 40 mIU/mL , surgical report ultrasound , 6 week postsurgical hysterectomy ovary failure confirm FSH > 40 mIU/mL Age ≥40 year ; ≥35 bilateral oophorectomy Normal clinical breast exam negative mammogram ≥ 40 year age Negative urine pregnancy test ( nonhysterectomized & < 12 month amenorrhea Enrollment Sponsor 's Study PR04409 PR05812 Participation clinical trial use investigational drug within 30 day prior screen Known hypersensitivity estrogen & /or progestin therapy Known suspect premalignant malignant disease history steroiddependent malignancy Manifestation treatment significant cardiovascular disease ( congestive heart failure , stroke ischemic attack , myocardial infarction , coronary artery bypass , percutaneous angioplasty > 50 % angiographic narrowing coronary artery Thrombophlebitis thromboembolic disorder history Insulindependent diabetes mellitus Increased frequency severity headaches hormone estrogen therapy Currently take St. John 's Wort Drug/alcohol addiction within past 2 year Treatment anticoagulant ( heparin warfarin ) Smoking ≥15 cigarettes/day
